notOwner: Hey bud, you have dug too deep into how the bot works! The command you have just ran is for the bot owner only :P you cannot do that!

:x: `{content}`

core.guildSettingsNotFound: During the execution of the command, a `KeyError` exception occurred. I think we are missing settings from this discord server, and we are fixing this issue. Please wait.
core.guildSettingsFixed: We have just replaced your guild (discord server) settings with the default values. My prefix is now `/`. Good to go now, huh? Run `/settings` again now. :)

tut.help:
The help command by default without any params (aka `/help`) will **list all commands**.
A __param__ (parameter) is a value that can be passed after typing the command. For example:
`/help tut`, where `tut` is a param, `help` is the command name, `/` is the prefix.
In the `help` command, if an argument is passed, and the command can be found, information about the command will be shown in an embed.
- description: virtual location of the command: `/<cog>/<command>/<sub-command-1>/<sub-command-2>`
- usage: if the parameter is quoted with `[]`, that means it is optional.
tut.embed:
Embed is a pretty way for bots to show data provided by discord.
An embed consists of:
- title
- description
- fields
- footer
- timestamp
- author name
- author avatar
- color / colour
- image
- url
- thumbnail
- video
